title: Hilary Duff and Malin Akerman take the plunge at the 5th Annual Adopt Together Baby Ball in LA
text:
Actress-mothers Hilary Duff and Malin Åkerman both took the plunge and rocked metallic heels at the 5th Annual Adopt Together Baby Ball, which took place Saturday night inside LA's Goya Studios.

32-year-old Hilary flaunted considerable cleavage in a red V-shaped top, silver belt, black mini-skirt, and chrome accessories selected by stylist Jessica Paster.

Hairstylist Nikki Lee coiffed The Haunting of Sharon Tate stunner's sleek middle-parted flaxen locks and Duff applied her own lashes and red pout.

Blonde ambition! Actress-mothers Hilary Duff (L) and Malin Åkerman (R) both took the plunge and rocked metallic heels at the 5th Annual Adopt Together Baby Ball, which took place Saturday night inside LA's Goya Studios

Joining the former child star on the red carpet was her fiancé Matthew Koma, who popped the question in May after collaborating on her 2015 album, Breathe In. Breathe Out.

'Mom and dad are going out tonight!' Hilary - who boasts 27.2M social media followers - Insta-storied from the car.

'It's our first year to attend. We're so excited! So many interesting facts about adoption that I didn't know. It's expensive and so Adopt Together helps families with the whole adoption process especially the financial part of it.

'It's really amazing and the work that they do is so commendable and close to their hearts. So we're so excited to go and support!'

Earlier that same day, Duff ran errands with their 16-month-old daughter Banks as well as her seven-year-old son Luca (from her six-year marriage to NHL alum Mike Comrie).

The blonde Texan and her blended brood shopped for Halloween costumes and they stopped by Bed Bath & Beyond in Studio City.

Hilary will have to get used to handling the kids on her own when the 32-year-old musician's band Winnetka Bowling League kicks off their 20-date tour next Thursday in Ohio.

Career-wise, Duff will next produce and and star in an upcoming Disney+ reboot of her Disney Channel series, Lizzie McGuire (2001-2004).

And in July, TV Land renewed the GlassesUSA collaborator's sitcom Younger for a seventh season, in which she plays Millennial Print publisher Kelsey Peters.

Meanwhile, Malin easily defied her 41 years in a lavender jumpsuit featuring a chest cut-out and hanging scarf detail as well as white clutch selected by stylist Molly Fishkin-Levin.

Hairstylist Maranda coiffed the Swedish-born, Toronto-raised bombshell's golded fringed bob, and she kept her make-up minimal.

Åkerman was joined by her brown-suited second husband Jack Donnelly, whom she wed on December 1 in Tulum after less than a year of dating.

The Billions actress and the 33-year-old Englishman also co-starred in Nicol Paone's dramedy Friendsgiving, which hits US theaters on January 1.

Jack is now stepfather to the Drunk History funnywoman's six-year-old son Sebastian with ex-husband Roberto Zincone.

On October 2, Malin wrapped her latest role in Trish Sie's Netflix-bound drama The Sleepover alongside Ken Marino, Karla Souza, and Joe Manganiello in Boston.
